intro: Geraniospermum angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved geraniospermum, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions, with deep root systems and waxy leaf surfaces to reduce water loss. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae, which includes many species with similar morphological traits. Geraniospermum angustifolium is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
